column4: Hello, I am at my wits end. I've tried everything. I've replaced my hard drive. and now..... I HAVE NOTIHNG. :(     Anyone know about trouble with SATA hard drives?
I did but it was actually a motherboard issue

What kind of motherboard issue? Check out my system spec here if you have the time, currently nothing is working on my computer except for the CDROM drives. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=826011&page=2

I also went into my BIOS settings and turned on RAID detection, this allowed me to get past the "Verifying DMI Pool data..." but now it just says Disk Boot Failure. The strange thing is I can install Ubuntu on the drive but it won't boot, my old drive was a SATA as well but it worked just fine... :-/
